block.p: Bridget Allyn Gilpatrick, a daughter of Michaele and James Gilpatrick of Baltimore, was married there last evening to Thomas Newton Armstrong IV, a son of Whitney Brewster Armstrong and Mr. Armstrong III of New York. The Rev. Thomas Gouleke performed the ceremony at St. Pius X Roman Catholic Church.

Mrs. Armstrong, 31, is an account supervisor at Lowe Lintas & Partners, the New York advertising agency. She graduated from Towson State University. Her father owns the Rolling Road Tobacco Warehouse, a tobacco and coffee shop in Lutherville, Md. Her mother owns the Appelbo Kennel in Baltimore, where she breeds Pembroke Welsh corgis and Newfoundlands.

Bridget Allyn Gilpatrick, a daughter of Michaele and James Gilpatrick of Baltimore, was married there last evening to Thomas Newton Armstrong IV, a son of Whitney Brewster Armstrong and Mr. Armstrong III of New York. The Rev. Thomas Gouleke performed the ceremony at St. Pius X Roman Catholic Church.

Mrs. Armstrong, 31, is an account supervisor at Lowe Lintas & Partners, the New York advertising agency. She graduated from Towson State University. Her father owns the Rolling Road Tobacco Warehouse, a tobacco and coffee shop in Lutherville, Md. Her mother owns the Appelbo Kennel in Baltimore, where she breeds Pembroke Welsh corgis and Newfoundlands.
Mr. Armstrong, 36, teaches physical education at the Churchill School and Center in New York. He graduated from New York University.

His father is the president of the Garden Conservancy, a nonprofit preservation organization in Cold Spring, N.Y., and a consultant to Sotheby's; he was the director of the Whitney Museum of American Art in New York from 1974 to 1990 and later of the Andy Warhol Museum in Pittsburgh. The bridegroom's mother is a director of the National Horse Show and of the Women's Prison Association, which provides counseling, halfway house accommodations and other services to female inmates.
